shortDescription: Immersive and experimental narrative game experienced through the opening and closing of your eyes.
longDescription: Closure is a first-person game primarily experienced with your eyes closed. The detection of when players' eyes are open or closed is crucial to the overall storytelling and gameplay experience. Working on a small, multidisciplinary team with 9 other game developers, my role as a Software Engineer R&D included developing and iterating on eye opening and closing detection and calibration solutions using landmark data provided by MediaPipe and implementing the game menu and UI interfaces. More specifically, my responsibilities include...
resumeBullets: Research, implement, and test new eye detection solutions and technologies.
Iterate on and debug the existing solution based on analyzing user data and feedback.
Develop a scalable architecture for game menus and UI interfaces.
Participate in regular code reviews, ensuring best coding practices are maintained to ensure a solid codebase architecture.
